relation: Sets the default number of recurring events if no end date is set
Sets the storage backend to be used for the semantic data (SQL or SPARQL).
Defers some tasks until after a page was edited by using the job queue.
Sets whether help information on the edit page is displayed
Enables SMW specific annotation and content processing for special pages
Sets the search engine to fall back to in case SMWSearch is used as custom search engine but is unable to interpret the search term as an semantic query.
Sets user defined properties having a dedicated table for them.
Sets whether internal links may be stored within property values.
Sets the maximum number of recurring events that can be defined regardless of a given end date
Sets the first namespace index to be used.
Defines for which namespaces the semantic links and annotations are to be evaluated.
Moves the update process for when a page / property and its value assignments are deleted to the job queue.
Sets the page related special properties to be used.
Sets a threshold value for when a property is being highlighted as "hardly being used" on Special:Properties
Shows properties where the usage count is zero on Special:Properties
Activates or deactivates all query related features and interfaces
Sets whether or not to omit categories marked with the HIDDENCAT behaviour switch from the annotation process.
textBeforeTable: The following settings relate to the basic installation of SMW. Installation settings 6.2 Miscellaneous settings 6.1 SPARQL and RDF store stettings 6 Other settings 5.2 OWL/RDF export 5.1 RSS export 5 Export settings 4.4 Settings for query formatting/display 4.3 Settings for concept queries 4.2 Settings for Special:Ask 4.1 Settings for inline queries 4 Query settings 3 Interface settings 2 Cache settings 1 Installation settings Contents Semantic MediaWiki offers a number of configuration options that site administrators may modify according to the particular needs of their wiki. This page explains all options of SMW 1.7.0 and higher. All available options can also be found in the file "SemanticMediaWiki.settings.php" of your current version. To change any configuration setting, copy the according assignment into your "LocalSettings.php" file, after including SMW as described in installation. Do not change the "SemanticMediaWiki.settings.php" file directly, as your changes would be overwritten in software
textAfterTable: Cache settings The following settings are relevant for the caching behaviour of SMW, such as special pages, factboxes etc. Parameter Description Default Since Until $smwgAutoRefreshOnPageMove Sets whether or not to refresh semantic data in the store when a page was moved. true 1.9.0 $smwgAutoRefreshOnPurge Sets whether or not to refresh semantic data in the store when a page is manually purged. true 1.9.0 $smwgCacheType Sets which object cache Semantic MediaWiki should use to track temporary changes. CACHE_ANYTHING 1.9.0 $smwgCacheUsage Controls the caching behaviour or special pages related to Semantic MediaWiki. array( … ); 1.9.0 $smwgFactboxCacheRefreshOnPurge Sets whether or not a cached factbox should be invalidated on an action=purge event. true 1.9.0 $smwgFactboxUseCache Sets whether or not a factbox content should be stored in cache. true 1.9.0 Interface settings The following settings are relevant for the general appearance of various
